data.title: Added script tree list, and function fast access
data.body:
This PR adds a new class `ScriptTreeList` to replace the `ItemList` in the `script_editor_plugin`, and adds quick function access, based on @puppetmaster- mockup in #2732.

The `ScriptTreeList` follows the same API as the `ItemList` class. It comes with a setting to enable list mode that will make it behave as before. If not running in list mode the `ScriptTreeList` will create a drop down containing all function in that file. By clicking on the function it will open the file and go to the function.

![code_tree](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6584330/17463972/6a9d1398-5ccb-11e6-94f2-d422e14bf8bb.png)

closes #3238

data.title: Add a API to add/remove items to the "Tools" menu
data.body:
Make possible add and remove items to the "Tools" menu.
The API is based on my [initial proposal](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/issues/1429#issuecomment-235047820) but i changed some things during the implementation:
- I removed the `has_plugin_menu_item`(I don't added it since other functions don't have it's `has_*` counterpart).
- All function were renamed to use `*_tool_*` instead of `*_plugin_*`, IMO this way it's clear that the functions are related to the "Tools" menu.
- The `int ID` parameter of `add_tool_menu_item` was changed to `Variant ud`, used for the callback function. 
- The callback format now is `callback(Variant ud)`, which made the code simpler and more flexible.
- The name format for the items, were changed from `"my_category/my_item"`/`"MyCategory/MyItem`" to `ANY string_Format/My Item Name` where the first slice is the item category, this way the name parameter is friendlier to translation(e.g. `"category/"+TTR("My Item Name")` or `vformat("categoty/%s", TTR("My Item Name"))`).

Closes #1429.

data.title: Plugin Page Updating
data.body:
I found this:

https://godotengine.org/article/plugins

But currently, this information seems outdated? If you put the plugins inside the addons folder, it doesn't show up in the project settings :P  . But then I found this thread while searching:

https://godotengine.org/qa/613/why-do-plugins-have-to-be-in-the-project-folder

..and it says the plugin directory is actual `Windows: %APPDATA%/Godot/plugins`

And I put my plugin in there and it works :D 

I think we should update that page so new devs that are searching wont have trouble like me

Regression in 2.1: Bug with opacity of a Polygon2D
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Windows 8.1 x64, Godot 2.1 RC2

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
I have a project, created in Godot 2.0.3 Stable. There are Polygon2D nodes, their opacity is not working in Godot 2.1 RC2. They are always 100% visible (making fog looks wierd). Tried to re-import textures, but it is not fixing problem. If I create new project and new scene in 2.1 RC2, opacity of the polygon is not working as well. Seems like something is changed in 2.1 making any polygon opcatiy working wrong.

**Steps to reproduce:**
In the description.

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):

![godotbug](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/19660324/17461284/bad291f8-5c8f-11e6-9b7c-7ad9ddba64fe.jpg)
Fog must be barely visible and stars must blink, but opacity aint working, so the things looks wierd.

data.title: A "-server" switch for Windows
data.body:
I was exploring the subject of "serverside godot", and since I work mainly on Windows there is no "platform=server_win32" build (just the linux target). I figured out "ok, so I can do OS.get_name() == "server" to check if this scene should run serverside scripts", but what if I'd like to run a server on Windows?

A possible way to do this would be to add a -server switch (executable arg) that would:
- Enable -quiet and -nowindow options
- Explicitly set OS name to Server
  This solution would work on every platform, unless submodules like the filesystem assume that "Server" OS means "use linux drivers".

An alternative would be to add a "server_win32" target, which would probably yield a smaller exe right? Any plans on that?

Or maybe there is a way to read execution arguments from script-level? Thoughts?

data.title: Editor settings are reset to defaults when restarting the editor
data.body:
Tested on Godot 2.1 rc1 and rc2, Windows 10 64 bits

Editor settings are reset to defaults if the editor is restarted without modifying them during the session.

This is very annoying because I have a scene containing a lot of data, and using Ctrl+S takes a few seconds of freeze to complete. Given that I use Ctrl+S a lot more when coding than editing the scene, I remapped Ctrl+S so it saves only the script instead of the scene. But it still freezes because the script is reloaded and also the scene for some reason. So I disabled auto-reload of scripts as my last hope. But after restarting twice the nightmare comes back :s

Repro:
1) Open the editor
2) Go to Editor Settings, Text Editor, uncheck "Auto-reload scripts on change" (or any checkbox, works with all of them I guess)
3) Close the editor
4) Open the editor, open Editor Settings, notice the options are remembered correctly
5) Don't modify them, close the editor
6) Open the editor again, open Editor Settings, notice the options are reverted to defaults.

Fixes_ #6035
But frankly I'd prefer to just revert the faulty line (https://github.com/godotengine/godot/commit/b80c42ef4e99ee155a98c7a2f17201280612257f#diff-1bd5d382d9201d75ddcd89131b5333c4R68) for 2.1 and merge this for 2.2, method binding is scary

Also document return type of `Object.call` and `GDScript.new`

data.title: grab_focus stopped working without call_deferred
data.body:
godot alpha 2.2 (5 aug build) linux x86

When I switched to new build (from 2.1 alpha), grab_focus stopped working everywhere. Script snippet: 

Conditions are satisfied (checked with print). Grab_focus refuses to work without doing call_deferred. With call_deferred grab_focus works. 
`func grab():`
`get_node("BattleMenu/VBoxContainer/Attack").grab_focus()`
`if (event.is_action_released("ui_accept") && !event.is_echo() && state == 'Idle'):`
`get_node("Main Menu").set_disabled(true)`
`battle.play("popup")`
`if get_node("BattleMenu/VBoxContainer/Attack").get("disabled") == false:`
`print("blerb")`
`call_deferred('grab')`
`elif get_node("BattleMenu/VBoxContainer/Magic").get("disabled") == false:`
`get_node("BattleMenu/VBoxContainer/Magic").grab_focus()`
`elif get_node("BattleMenu/VBoxContainer/Special").get("disabled") == false:`
`get_node("BattleMenu/VBoxContainer/Special").grab_focus()`
`elif get_node("BattleMenu/VBoxContainer/Items").get("disabled") == false:`
`get_node("BattleMenu/VBoxContainer/Items").grab_focus()`
`get_tree().set_pause(true)`
`state             = 'BattleMenu'`

data.title: Directory.open error 31's when passed user:// path with /home being a symlink
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Athlon FX8320 (8-core) x64 16 GB RAM **linux/X11** Godot v2.1.beta (HEAD at 6d5d23fa8de8673f4a2b312c05588fd4e7195543)

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):

``` GDScript
extends Node

func _ready():
    var loc="user://"
    var dir=Directory.new()
    var err=dir.open(loc)
    if err==OK:
        dir.list_dir_begin()
        var name=dir.get_next()
        while name!="":
            print(name)
            name=dir.get_next()
    else:
            print("Failed to list ",loc," due to: ",err)
```

gives output like:
`Failed to list user:// due to 31`
(ERR_INVALID_PARAMETER)
The output should perhaps be the contents at user://

If _loc_ is changed to something like `OS.get_data_dir()` it starts working and properly outputs a listing at user:// (OS.get_data_dir() yields the absolute path of user://)

This could be rather troublesome in games that want to have multiple saves and provide a custom dialog to select a save game to continue from (since it'll get res:// on the above code rather than the saves) and wishes to peek into the saved games to show character, level, etc. like many console RPGs do.

**Steps to reproduce:**
see above.

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):
~~Edit: I ended up making a small project to show the problem is not a project having no name: [Project file link](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/403760/test.tar.gz)~~
That project is out of date.  Please see the above code.

data.title: VisualScripting nodes reset their position after removing some other connected node
data.body:
Looks like issue from ShaderGraph https://github.com/godotengine/godot/issues/4869 found it's way into visual scripting too.

How to reproduce: 
- Have some connected nodes in your visual script
- Press [x] close on one of the nodes
- Node is closed, but other nodes reset their positions and get stickied to cursor as if you're dragging them

data.title: Fix #5891 by not expecting the script instance to be a GDInstance
data.body: It could be a placeholder instance as well. This fix makes use of C++ OOP and polymorphism, ~~might need a check if some console compilers don't like it.~~ Edit: It is already used a few lines above, so no need to check it there.

data.title: Error compiling android release in variant_call.cpp
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Ubuntu 16.04 64bit
Latest godot master branch

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
Compiling with `scons platform=x11` works fine.

Compiling with `scons platform=android target=debug` works fine if the visual scripting module is removed. Otherwise exits with

```
modules/visual_script/visual_script_editor.cpp: In member function 'void VisualScriptEditor::_member_edited()':
modules/visual_script/visual_script_editor.cpp:686:84: error: invalid cast to function type 'String()'
   EditorNode::get_singleton()->show_warning(TTR("Name is not a valid identifier:")+" "+new_name);
                                                                                    ^
modules/visual_script/visual_script_editor.cpp:696:100: error: invalid cast to function type 'String()'
   EditorNode::get_singleton()->show_warning(TTR("Name already in use by another func/var/signal:")+" "+new_name);
                                                                                                    ^
modules/visual_script/visual_script_editor.cpp: In member function 'void VisualScriptEditor::_member_button(Object*, int, int)':
modules/visual_script/visual_script_editor.cpp:998:62: error: invalid cast to function type 'String()'
     edit_variable_dialog->set_title(TTR("Editing Variable:")+" "+name);
                                                              ^
modules/visual_script/visual_script_editor.cpp:1024:58: error: invalid cast to function type 'String()'
     edit_signal_dialog->set_title(TTR("Editing Signal:")+" "+name);
                                                          ^
modules/visual_script/visual_script_editor.cpp: In member function 'void VisualScriptEditor::drop_data_fw(const Point2&, const Variant&, Control*)':
modules/visual_script/visual_script_editor.cpp:1542:45: error: 'class SceneTree' has no member named 'get_edited_scene_root'
    Node* sn = _find_script_node(get_tree()->get_edited_scene_root(),get_tree()->get_edited_scene_root(),script);
                                             ^
modules/visual_script/visual_script_editor.cpp:1542:81: error: 'class SceneTree' has no member named 'get_edited_scene_root'
    Node* sn = _find_script_node(get_tree()->get_edited_scene_root(),get_tree()->get_edited_scene_root(),script);
                                                                                 ^
modules/visual_script/visual_script_editor.cpp:1542:111: error: '_find_script_node' was not declared in this scope
    Node* sn = _find_script_node(get_tree()->get_edited_scene_root(),get_tree()->get_edited_scene_root(),script);
                                                                                                               ^
modules/visual_script/visual_script_editor.cpp:1589:45: error: 'class SceneTree' has no member named 'get_edited_scene_root'
    Node* sn = _find_script_node(get_tree()->get_edited_scene_root(),get_tree()->get_edited_scene_root(),script);
                                             ^
modules/visual_script/visual_script_editor.cpp:1589:81: error: 'class SceneTree' has no member named 'get_edited_scene_root'
    Node* sn = _find_script_node(get_tree()->get_edited_scene_root(),get_tree()->get_edited_scene_root(),script);
                                                                                 ^
modules/visual_script/visual_script_editor.cpp:1589:111: error: '_find_script_node' was not declared in this scope
    Node* sn = _find_script_node(get_tree()->get_edited_scene_root(),get_tree()->get_edited_scene_root(),script);
                                                                                                               ^
scons: *** [modules/visual_script/visual_script_editor.android.debug.armv7.neon.o] Error 1
scons: building terminated because of errors.
```

Compiling (without the visual scripting module for the above reason) with `scons platform=android target=release` exits with error:

```
core/variant_call.cpp: In static member function 'static Vector<StringName> Variant::get_method_argument_names(Variant::Type, const StringName&)':
core/variant_call.cpp:1196:18: error: 'const struct _VariantCall::FuncData' has no member named 'arg_names'
  return E->get().arg_names;
                  ^
core/variant_call.cpp: In static member function 'static Variant::Type Variant::get_method_return_type(Variant::Type, const StringName&, bool*)':
core/variant_call.cpp:1209:26: error: 'const struct _VariantCall::FuncData' has no member named 'return_type'
   *r_has_return=E->get().return_type;
                          ^
core/variant_call.cpp:1211:18: error: 'const struct _VariantCall::FuncData' has no member named 'return_type'
  return E->get().return_type;
                  ^
scons: *** [core/variant_call.android.opt.armv7.neon.o] Error 1
scons: building terminated because of errors.
```

data.title: Visual Script editor is too small
data.body:
Visual Script editor is too small. There should be an option to get VS editor (that window with graph and those two lists on left) to another window and fullscreen it.

Because it's not a code it cannot be opened in external editor, and Godot has too small window to edit it comfortably.

![zrzut ekranu 2016-08-04 o 18 39 40](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/959429/17410167/d7b2be5c-5a72-11e6-8755-c373f7fab344.png)
